text: Cask. Moderate funk, light cheesy, light barley. Taste is the same. Light sourness. Good, but nothing noteworthy compared to the mature versions.

Draught at Cantillon Brewery, Brussels. Golden with no head. The aroma has notes of yeasts, wood, vegetables, vinegar and some fruitiness. Sour flavor with notes of lemon, wood, some fruitiness, white wine, bitterish, lemon zest. Watery, slightly dry, light-bodied. A bit aggressive but nice.
At the brewery. Clear golden. Aroma of oak and Brett. Sour, lemony, oak, green apples, a bit bitter. Light-bodied, flat.

Tap. Open Baladin, Rome. Pours a still light gold boy with zero head. The nose is fairly light, still a bit sweet with just a light hint of funkiness. The flavor is very minimally tart and funky on the finish, almost a standard wheat beer up front at first. Theres just the slightest Cantillon character to this. Light to medium bodied, completely flat, the finish is rather short for a lambic. Not the greatest drink, but awesome to see the beginnings of what will become amazing after more time in the barrel.

Bag in a Box at Muted Horn Berlin. Pours with a hazy golden color and a very tiny white head. The nose is restrained, just some fruits like apple and pears, some acidity notes. Taste of bitter.sour wood, some sour fruits. Corbonation is completly missing.
Fun to try at Cantillon, but really prefer their finished products. Clearly sour, but lacking a lot.
Hazy pale yellow liquid, no head. Sour aroma. Light body, no carbonation. Taste is very sour and dry.

Cask at moeder. Pours a clear golden orange from the cask with fluffy white head that dissipates slowly to leave light lace. Aroma of big funky notes and a hint of sweetness. Taste follows, clean and funky, really nice.

12th August 2016GBBF Day 4. Keg. Hazy gold beer, not much of a head. Palate is light, dry and has mild crispness. Mildly tart with ripe lemon and orange. Touch of wet wood. Some floral character before a light dry finish. Pretty mellow and quite drinkable but for the life of me I dont get all these stratospheric scores for this beer.
Pours a slightly hazy yellow with no lacing. The aroma is apple and vinegar. Faint tartness. Zero carbonation

On cask at Moeder. Clear golden color with off-white head. Aroma is really woody and rustic with some fermented fruits on top. Taste starts tart, bitter and woody and lingers on the aftertaste with bitter wood flavor. It has some funk but mostly you get the spicy wood flavors. Body is quite light and almost flat. Its a very different lambic from what I had from bottles. The lack of carbonation makes it really easy to drink and the cask notes really shine through.

ASPETTO: oro antico quasi limpido, schiuma assente. AROMA: acido, abbondante vinoso (vino bianco fruttato), floreale. GUSTO: acido, marcio (soprattutto nel retrogusto), citrico, vinoso. Retrogusto marcio, polveroso e si sente anche il fresco del limone.
Draft at Cantillon. Aroma of fresh tart sourness and some wheat. Nice fresh taste of fresh tart, mild oak and soft wheat. Nice to taste this.
Clear golden color with no carbonation. Notes of wood and moderately sour, medium mouthfeel.
From the decanter into the glass. at the Cantillon Brewery: Slightly hazy golden colored brew with an very sour taste and its also very dry and earthy.

Bue au cask en 12cl à la brasserie Cantillon à Anderlecht.
Couleur blonde aucune mousse ni aucune effervescence.
Nez sur le bois et le lambic.
Attaque sur le bois, le chêne la feuille juste équilibrage parfait.

On tap in Cantillon brewery. Clear pale amber, urine looking beer with almost no carbonation. Nose is sweaty, barnyard, very slightly sour, urine, funky, lightly citrousy. Taste is flat, uncarbonated, sweaty, dry, light fruity citrous, barnyard, slightly cheesy.
Clear golden. Aroma is barnyard, basement and wood. Taste is sour with notes of brett.
From pitcher at the brewery. Clear golden. No head. Fruity sour and cobweb. Barnyard and acid. Brilliant dry and sour. Easy drinkable. Awesome

A glass from the barrel at Cantillon. Aroma of hops (hallertau) and yeast; Brett. with notes of Wood and basement. The flavour is moderat sour and dry. The body is light and the texture is watery. A world class experience...
at the brewery: clear golden, no head, acidic smell, fruity, qitew bitter, dry oily mouthfeel, barnyard taste, bitter finish

cask at Chez Moeder Lambic - Hazy gold pour with a big, rapidly fading head. It has the characteristic soft carbonation of a cask ale. It has a very tart and funky aroma and taste. Light sweetness. Interesting and good.

Sampled at various occasions at the brewery and elsewhere. Shady golden, low to medium white head. Fruity, mellow, some wood, a few times with a slightly disturbing rubber note. Medium bodied, low carbonation. Semi dry, medium acidity.
Borefts 2014. Nice light orange, some bubbles, no head. Grains, funkiness, hay, light sour. Backlog from 2014/09/27.
@ Cantillon 15-10-30: Ganska lätt och enkel doft. Smaken är lätt syrlig och ölen känns tydlig ung och omogen. Gott hur som hälst.
Light funk with citrus passion fruit notes, a bit of apricot and a clear bitterness. Some tannins and light astringency, more fruity, and not so tart.
Sampled with Jean at Shelton Bros Festival. Clean, light, and refreshing. Lots of wheat and yeast notes. No carbonation, but with a good mouthfeel and body.
Taster @ Cantillon. Hazy golden body with no head. Light dusty, earthy, nutty. Very drinkable.
At cantillon. Cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma of earth alot of tart, grape, green apples, cantillon base, musty. Unblended is not really my thing yet.
cask at moeder lambic, fontinashazy amber with spritzy carbonation, some malt sweetness alongside sharp lemon juice lactic character but little development of brett yet
Tap at Zwanze Day Zurich. A very beautiful lambic, probably a younger one. Incredibly smooth and easy to drink. Wow!

18 months old.  light gold pour aroma woody. tastes raisin soy rich vanilla oak. tons of wood character. I like this a lot more than their guezes because of its much more distinct oak character. mild tang.

Cantillon lambik on tap at Moeder it was a fairly clear gold with a soapy white head. The taste was sharply sour and metallic giving me lemon tartness in the finish but I felt it needed more age. Jonge 3 while a few days later at the brewery I had the 18 month old version - it was way way better. It was a  bright clear gold. The taste was lightly tart with a bit of the horsey Brett. Oude 3.9
Tasting at the Cantillon Brewery. Golden with no head. Cider-like, sour apples, barnyard. Medium to low sweet at first then tart but controlled sourness for lambic. Flat, oily, medium body.

Draught @ Lambic Foeder. Vintage 2014. Rated on 25.06.2015
 Aroma has grapefruit and earthy tones. Flavour has strong orange, some milky notes, grapefruit and citrus. Clearly has not yet reached the full sourness level but still enjoyable.

(tap 0,25l @ Moeder Lambic (Brussels))
Aroma: Tart, light sourish.
Appearance: Hazy golden color. All time, white head.
Taste: Very sour, light sweet, some sour fruits.
Palate: Sour finish.
Overall: I think now, I just dont like sours...

KEg at the 24th Weekend Of Spontaneous Fermentation then again at Cantillon. Cloudy Irn Bru looking pour with no head. Citrus zest and farmyard funk. Theres a decent, tart wedge of lemon. Dusty farmyard funk. Delicious.

At Nuetnigenough from a "bag", 12th May 15. Served at room temperature, almost warm, cloudy appearance, aroma is rich, musty, earthy mysterious. Taste is unrefined, sweetish, not sour, grainy 
, earthy and unusual. Really enjoyed it
En fût. Couleur dorée translucide, peu de mousse. Arôme de malt, pomme, côté vieux fromage, poussiéreux. Goût de malt, légère acidité, côté vin blanc. Absence de carbonatation, corps moyen faible.

Tasted sample at the brewery in Belgium.
No gas at all. Aroma is zesty and a bit earthy. Taste is very sour with slight woodiness.
Somewhat hazed yellow with a white head of foam. The aroma is grainy and just mildly funky. Some tartness, but never really gets sour. Medium body and medium carbonation.

At the brewery. Pours a slightly hazy golden color, a bit pale. No head to speak of, very flat. Cellar, earthy aroma, barnyard with cider-feel to it. Grapes. Taste mildly sweet with moderate soury feel in continuation. A pretty nice one.
Draft at the brewery - pours orange/yellow. No carbonation. Smell is lemon zest, earthy, grassy notes. Taste is lemons, tart, acidic.

2015/05/01 - On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas in Brussels. Hazy orange straw colour with an off white, soapy head that lingers. Aroma is tart lemon, sour green apple, hay and barnyard. Taste is mildly sweet and moderately sour with tart lemon, hay and very mild barnyard. Mouthfeel is light with very mild carbonation and a tart, drying, dusty finish. Light, refreshing and crisp.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dalla botte, bevuto alla Brasserie. Lambic di 4 mesi. aromi molto intensi, forse ancora un pò spigolosi. Molto presente il legno, il polveroso, la cantina e la rusticità Anche al palato si mantiene molto rustico ed intenso. Fantastico.

Sweet and fruity aroma with butterscotch oak, faint barnyard and refreshing sourness, white grape, cranberry. Slightly hazy gold with no carbonation. Dry and slightly sour white grape, cranberry, oak, with slightly bitter tannins that are woody. Light body, very low, but not non-existent, carbonation.
On tap at BBF. Hazy orange colour with white head. Fruity, brett aroma. Sweet, acidic, brett, fruity taste. Medium body.
Un bon lambic tout en élégance et équilibre, raffraîchissant et harmonieux, un régal pour commencer la soirée.

Golden pale and a tiny bit cloudy color. The smell is a bit like old cheese. No carbonation and a lot of old cheese and a bit of horse stable. The aftertaste is not that overwhelming, still a very good lambic.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2015 Draught at Moeder Lambic. Golden color with inch thick head. A subtle Lambic funk, a bit of residual sugars, hay, wood, apples and lemony, dry finish. Flat. Good and interesting.

On tap at Erzbierschof: Hay, lemons, a subtle funk again, subtle lemons and low sourness, with hints of residual sugars in the body, just the right amount to create a balance. Incredibly smooth and creamy. Easy drinking. A perfect beginners lambic.

January 23, 2015. On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. 
Hazy orange with light minimal white head. Aroma is tart green apples, lemon, some earthy barnyard notes in the back. Taste is light sweet, medium tart with green apple skin, lemon and some earthy and dusty notes in the finish together with tart apples. Smooth medium bodied, soft almost flat carbonation.

Less than 1yo sold as young lambiek, from earthenware [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 02/2015. Flat, dank, mellifluous horsepiss of a semi-mature lemonade, laden with smooth residual sugars, old candied orange and graperuit zest while wandering wood tones lead the palate towards a quenching finish that hints at a second glass. Sweeter than some other jonge lambieks and quite round and harmonious. Pure unpasteurised young&wild goodness in a glass, - bottle this in a bag for everyday culinary use and watch the masses convert?

Nyupptappad direkt från [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ bryggeri. Gyllengul vätska, lätt grumlig. Doftar fruktigt med lite syrlig arom. Smakar syrligt och lite kärnkärvt. Kort eftersmak där syrligheten och kärvheten klingar av och ersättts av en lätt dammighet och lite frukter.

Cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours lightly hazy gold with a large, frothy white head, long retention with light lacing. Aroma is lightly sweet malt, funky and tart bacteria with vinous notes and subdued walnuts. Flavor is initially tart and acidic lemon with light malt and a light sweetness and a dry finish. Light body and soft carbonation.

Sample poured from the ceramic jug at Cantillon. Poured hazy yellow and uncarbonated. Slightly funky, acidic and tart. No sweetness. It was very educational to taste this alongside the older lambics. Fantastic experience!
From stoneware jug at Cantillon. Still, hazy, wheat, funk, tart. Really tasty, happy I got to try it.

27/IX/14 - on tap @ Borefts 2014 (Bodegraven) - BB: n/a (2014-1158) Thanks to Benzai, fonefan and cgarvieuk for sharing todays beers!
Note: funny, after almost 5 years of intense beer rating, visiting tons of Belgian beer festivals, having visited the brewery about 5 times, I ultimately have to turn to a Dutch beer festival to finally drink on the the last missing Belgian straight lambics on my list. 
Little hazy yellow to orange beer, small irregular creamy white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very sour, fruity, cherries in a jar, bit funky, woody, bit chemical. MF: no carbon, medium body. Taste: soft sourness, very refreshing, bit lemony, dairy, touch, little bitter, orange and lemon rind. Aftertaste: nice sour, grapefruit, little bitter, funky, woody notes, nice bitterness.

Poured from a ceramic jug at Cantillon at the end of the tour. During the tour, I watched the guy fill up two large plastic containers that had taps in them. He said he hoped they would last the day. this beer was slightly hazy and Amber in color. No carbonation. Sour funky and good.
From jug @ Cantillon. 9 months old. Pours hazy golden with a small head. Light funk, sweet apples, lemon and stable.

From the jug at Cantillon in October 2014. 

Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma and taste of funk, some green apples, lemon, light vinegar and wood. The body was light and the finish dry. It was interesting to try such a young and very fresh Cantillon at the Brewery.

Pours hazy light yellow with some fainted lighter hues. Thin shortlasting white head. Aromas of sour green apples, lots of vinegar and some yeast. Pretty vineous aswell. Taste is tart apples up front, some vinegar and some stable-like notes.

[9/27/14] Jug sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2014 in Bodegraven. Hazy golden. Funky aroma with barnyard, sweat, fruits and a bit of floral notes. Sourish funky flavor with barnyard, oak and some citrus. Flat mouthfeel. Great and refreshing.
Smells of vinegar with hints of apples and white wine. The taste is at first an acid kick, followed by a delayed fizzy explosion. Exciting, very unfamiliar. Hard to judge beers in this genre.
Sample at the brewery. Comes a cloudy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of fruit and funk. Taste is fruit, funk, citrus, and earth. Interesting in a nice way. Glad I got to try this.

Borefts Bier Festival 2014. Unclear orange body with no head. Aroma is tart and sour, apples, vinegar. Taste of grapes, dry white wine, leather, acidic finish. Highly acidic. Not one to replace your daily lambic, but Im really excited to have tasted it.

Didnt know this was a special entry.. Sample at bbf, poured a cloudy yellow orange colour with a white head. Citrus, horse blanket, lemon zest, cheese, sour green apples, funk, tart, a lot more fruit notes as normal geuze.
Sampled @ Borefts 2014 day 2. Hazy a bit pale yellow color, small white head. Smell yellow fruits, citrus, slightly sour. Taste sourish, sour fruits, quite balanced, with a fruitpeel bitter finish.

Borefts Beer Festival 2014. Cloudy golden with a small white head. Funky aroma with grapefruit and pine notes. Dry and tart flavour with funky notes, wood and a hint of mint. Tasted more mature than most jonge lambik I have had

Some bubbles. Apple, sour, vinegar. Surprisingly soft tasting. Very thin body and watery almost but quite more complexity than expected from such a young beer. The sourness is more mellow than I feared and theres some dusty earthy yeast hints already there. Nice Lambic (but I still dont get most of the craze around it). (On tap at Borefts 2014)

@ BBF 14. Pours hazy golden with a very tiny white head. Aroma is very rural with lots of musty oak, stable, a gentle tartness, floral notes and kinda clean overall. Smells young bro! Taste is tart and soft with notes of horse blanket, sweet moldy oak, lemon, vinegar and pretty easy drinking.
sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2014: trübes orangegelbes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch nach reifen Früchten, holzig, würzig. Geschmack säuerlich, fruchtig, hefig, holzig, trocken.

Poured from a jug at Borefts 2014. Pours very hazy golden orange with a ring off white head. Aroma of light funk, citrus, fruits and barnyard. Flavour is light sweet and light moderate acidic. Medium bodied with flat carbonation.
Borefts. Beautiful light orange brown with only some bubbles but no real head. Dry grains, funk, hay, light sour with big vegetal bitter finish. Quite nice.

Keg at the de molen festival 2014... Golden amber... Thin white lacing.. Zezty lemon.. Soft funky nose... Horseblanket... Soft fruits... Light acetic tones... Floral and funky... Very interesting but not me

Straight from the jug at the brewery.

Pours flat, orange/yellow/rusty in color, bubbles on top. Nose is tons funk, light acidity, and oak. Flavor is very similar to the nose, but slightly more funky and a little less acidic. Light body, flat, dry funky finish.

Really enjoyed trying this super-fresh sample a the brewery and is pretty cool to see a part of the final product of Classic Geuze.

Boy I love this brewery. This brew is fantastic. Big sour mellon aroma...so great you can get this without the usuall carbonation of other beers. *our mostly flat with a 1/16 inch head that died fast. Tasted acid lemon and slight ;peach. Great dry finish leaving you wanting so much more.

Tasted at the brewery and at Weekend der Spontane Gisting. This is the raw material from which all Cantillons wonderful lambic variations are derived. Hazy golden blonde, no head as expected, no carbonation. Complex funky aroma, barnyard, lots of fresh, sharp citric and mellow lactic acidity, and all the estery wild yeast fruitiness you can find in the Cantillon products. I recommend anyone into old geuze to taste the pure, unblended lambics of the producers in order to fully understand them.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2014. Se distingue par un abord doux, léger et aérien avec une acidité fine mais moyennement longue et savoureuse. Le nez est fort fruité, peu acide presque sans amertume. Le corps malté est doux et rond, fromenté, fruité, citronné (raisin, pomme) moyen se finissant avec une amertume minérale. Certainement moins lourde à boire quune gueuze. Bien

6 month sample at the brewery. Pours a cloudy golden yellow with no head at all. The beer is still. Aromas of mild citrus, earth tones, clay, acid. Taste is sour, acidic. Mouthfeel is light due to a lack of carbonation.

On tap, 25cL. @Moeder St Gilles, Brussels. The waiter told me this lambic was about 1 year old. A hazy yellow pale beer with a medium white head with big bubbles. Poor persistence. Aroma of apple, wood, smoke, acid lactic, vinegar. It begins with a neutral touch, then it´s a sour storm. Heavy lasting sour. Light body, thin texture, soft to flat carbonation, dry sour finish. Overall, happy to drink this one. Beautiful as a wild landscape. A bit extreme for me on the sour side but interesting and necessary to fully understand and appreciate other beers from Cantillon.
@ Quintessence. Buttery popcorns, cheesy and murky with wood, lemon and some sour apples.

Cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels. The server told me this was about 1 year old. Hazy pale amber shade, little head. Aroma is wild, buttery, white wine. Dry, oaky and puckeringly sour taste. Finish goes on forever. Typical Cantillon complexity to it. Seems to be at an interesting transitionary point between the young and old stages, and has qualities from both, but I would put it on the young side, just.

Hazy amber yellow, no head. Aroma of citrus peel, grass and straw. Sour, green apples, citrus and hay. Moderate, dry, almost sharp aftertaste, typical Cantillon funkiness is present, but only in a supporting role. All in all very agressive on the palate, due to the untamed sourness. Not one-dimensional, but not as complex and balanced as the "Ouder" versions.

Have tried many fresh sample bottles (thanks Meg et. al), sampled at the first Shelton Festival in Worcester (this Jonge lambik, along with two and three year, respectively), and finally got to sample this at the brewery in 2012 straight from the pitcher into a taster tulip. Very young and seemingly one-dimensional as one might expect, however packs a nice, blunt cidery punch with a strong funk and budding acidiy presence. Very cool to try one of the components of one of my favorite geuzes on its own, helps you truly develop perspective on what comprises a gueuze, and what blending really does.
@ Cantillon Quintessence. Amber colour, no head. Flat, no carbonation. Sour and funky lambic with lots of green apples. Dry and tart finish. Good.
Sample @Cantillon Quintessence 2014. Pours little cloudy yellow/orange. Aroma is sour and fruity. Taste is sour, bitter, grainy.

From cask, Quintessence 2014. Hazy gold pour with no head. Aroma is quite funky, really cheesy, strong Cantillon signature, more so even than the gueuze. Taste is sour, lots of really cheesy flavors, yeasty, lactic acidity with light citrusy notes, wet hay. Palate is light, flat, medium dryness (for Cantillon). Nice lambic.
Bittert popcorn! That is all i can say Amazing time To try it but it's all just buttery popcorn lambic! Drinkable!!

Cask @ Cantillon Quintessence 2014. Hazy golden with no head and no lacing. Aroma is super lemony with grassy notes, easily recognizable Cantillon funk and oak. Taste is also lemony with Cantillon funk, grass, oak and musty notes. Medium body. Flat carbonation. Dry finish. Very good unblended lambic; one of my favorite so far. Really tasty and quite quenching.

Bevuta da Moeder, spillata dal cask. Si presenta con pochissima schiuma e quasi per nulla frizzante. Lacidità tipica dello stile si unisce ad una sapiente maltazione e luppolatura che dona alla birra aromi complessi di agrumi ed una ottima beverinità.

The beer looks awefull, no foam at all. But this is I think how beer used to be. Sour aroma, some green apple, candy. Little sour taste, also some light sugar notes. Fresh and refreshing drink. (@ Cantillon Brussel 201404)
Tried at the brewery. Flat with some vinegar, hay, green grapes and citrus.

At the brewery. Mild weich im Antrunk. Die typische Cantillon-Note kommt im Hauptteil zur Geltung, aber mild und nicht sehr penetrant. Sehr süffig, weich. Der Nachgeschmack ist lang und intensiv, leicht holzig, angenehm Cantillon-sauer und sehr schön weich und mild. Toll. Pferdedecke ist sehr mild und nicht aufdringlich. Noch ein sehr weiches und kaum saures Exemplar! 
--> 13/13/13/13

Tap at Open Baladin, Roma, 08/02/14.
Lightly hazed golden with a thin off white head that dissipates edgeward.
Nose is lemon rind, straw, light vinegar strains, puff of smoke, light citric enfused acidic waftings.
Taste comprises burnt citric tinged straw, subtle acidic tinges, musty, dank wood, light vinegar tones.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, tarte and bitter lemon twinges in the close, light acidic throat scrape.
Solid dank stuff.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Sampler at the brewery. 1 year old. Clear golden headless body. Apple jam and funky notes on the nose. Sour grapefruit in the mouth along with cereal and a lasting bitterness. Medium bodied and mouthwatering.
Orange and slightly cloudy with some floaters. Smelled leather sour then fruit. Very complex beer with sourness punching through barnyard in the end.

Cruche à Cantillon.
Orangé-ambrée complètement plat.
Arôme est agréable, complexe tout en restant la base de la gueuze. Notes boisées de chêne, de grains avec des effluves terreuses et poussiéreuses légères.
Palais est sec, malté moyen sur pointe acerbe, fruité-citronné modéré même avec labsence de houblon. Tout cela tire un peu sur le terreux et une pointe de suret.

From the brewery. Was described as "less than a year old". Everything about this had not settled, as it was clearly young. As part if the tour tasting, they give you this first to test your palate to see if you should even request a second (different) beer. Good idea, as this saves the good stuff for the rest of us.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Glass sampled from a pitcher at the brewery. Pours a hazy yellow/brownish yellow in color with very little head formation. Its pretty flat overall. The nose is lemon rind, must, barnyard, and some light apple. I can definitely tell the difference between this sample and the oude lambik on cask at Moeder. This doesnt quite have the assertive acidity that the Oude lambik does and it doesnt seemed nearly as developed. The flavors are softer, but unrefined in comparison. Light, dull mouthfeel that is a little watery and oily. Has a short to moderate finish. While this wouldnt bet first choice when it comes to Cantillon, it was definitely cool to see the progression of their lambic.

Free glass from brewery. Pours gold/yellow and a little hazy with absolutely no head. The aroma is full of fruits and sours. Very fresh smell. Taste of sour apples, citrus fruits. Really sour tart tongue shriveling flavors. Smack!! Mouthfeel is thin and dry, like white wine with mild sparkling. Nice beer but too much like wine for me.

On cask

Pours hazy blond, two finger white head.

Smell classic Cantillon funk, decent tartness

Taste sour, horse blanket on tail. Wheat and funk

Lighter bodied, refreshing

Nice

Less than 1 year old, drunk at the brewery. Smell of sour apple. Hazy amber colour, virtually no head. Sour, no head. Aroma of white wine, cider, apple. Some yeast. Sour, lightly bitter wit sweetness in finish. Oily texture.
1 year old poured from the jug at the brewery. Hazy gold color, perfectly still with no head. Light, tart aroma. Light flavor that doesnt overpower you. A gateway lambic. Classic.
On tap at Cantillon brewery. Orange, slightly hazy, flat. Bitter, dry (very), and a bit sour. Smells of horseblanket, sour. Goes down pretty easily. Prefer the blended gueuzes though.

Cask @Chez Moeder Lambic Fontaines. Fruity, grapy, some tart aromas. Pours golden, a bit hazy, with nice creamy white head, persistent, poor lacing. Light body, texture is a bit sticky, average carbonation. Taste is fruity, grapy, tart, some sweet hints. Very smooth, balanced and enjoyable.

At Cantillon brewery.

Really cool thing to try not as good as expected. But very cool.

Fra fat på Cantillon-bryggeriet etter rundtur uten guide: dette blir vel så ekte som overhode mulig.Ulikt det meste annet jeg har smakt, og attpåtil er det godt, ikke bare interessant! En unik opplevelse som jeg gjerne gjør igjen, og nå vet jeg hvordan man finner lettest mulig fram til plassen.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2013 Cask at Fontainas. Deep, glowing orange-gold, tall, fime head. Lemon and grapefruit zest, leather, horse blanket nose. Biting sour and funk, grapefuit, leather, dust. Funky ass. Tiny sweetness. Rather unforgiving, clean, teeth stripping. Astringent and a bit too raunchy.

Jar @ the brewery, Brussels. 5 months old. Rated on 28.2.2013.
Had this after the brewery tour. Pours a cloudy yellow colour and a white foamy head. Aroma of very raw and pungent lemon zest, grapefruit and surprisingly strong grassy notes. Flavour is also very raw and citrusy with even stronger grapefruiity notes, white grapes, grass and lactic acid. Medium bodied, dry mouthfeel and a sharp, citrusy, bitter finish. Raw and aggressive as expected.
Jar @ the brewery. No head. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are brett, leather, barnyard, hay, malt and vinegar.

At the brewery. Almost clear golden liquid with minimal white head. Aroma of lemons, grain, apples, barnyard and minerals. Taste is dry and light to medium sour with notes of lemons, apples and funk. Light to medium bodied with no carbonation. Nice.

Glass @ Cantillon from a pitcher. Hazy light amber served still with just some small bubbles around the edge of the glass. Aroma is musty barnyard, damp earthy oak, vinegar and some bitter citrus peel. Flavor is super tart, sour and acidic with a tiny amount of malt sweetness and bitterness. Light body and no carbonation. Very odd beer, served room temperature and still takes a bit of getting used to.

On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas,  pours a cloudy yellow with a fairly large white head. Aroma of mild barnyard funk, a little citrus zest and some moderate horse blanket. Flavour is very citric, sour and also incredibly bitter, with loads of dry citrus zest, incredibly potent mouth-drying hops, and mild funk. One of the most bitter lambics Ive had. Finishes dry, citric and bitter. Good stuff, but not among my favourite Cantillons.

Provata dalla brocca direttamente in birreria alla cantillon.
Chiara, trasparente, senza schiuma.
Molto acida e già discreto corpo...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iFox

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Sample at Cantillon brewery. Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: clear blonde beer, no foam, no carbonation.
Nose: oranges, pineapples, apple, grains are very prominent, barnyard, rather sweet as well though.
Taste: starts rather fruity but goes very dry afterwards. Very bitter, lots of grains. It has a large dry out effect, its somewhat sour but compensated nicely with the amount of sugar remaining in this beer.
Altogether a very nice drinking beer with a balance between sourness and sweetness.

Sample @ Cantillon brewery. The guy pouring it mentioned this was eleven or twelve months old. Slightly hazy golden pour with a moderate bubbly white head. The nose is sherry, some tart apple and raspberry fruits. Lightly wood. Nice soft earthy flavors. More apple, hints of caramel, mildly dry wood in the finish. Soft sourness. Super drinkable stuff. Good.

On cask at Moeder Lambic. Pours slightly hazy yellow/orange with a lofty white head. The smell is grapefruit, citrus, lemon...nice nose. The taste is a little must, lemon, mild pink grapefruit with a slight malt sweetness. Light in body and a little slippery with only a hint of effervescence. Great stuff!

a new cantillon ( to me) is always intresting, even if its pure lambik. 
at cantillon brewerie, 
smells sour, cantillon funk, 
taste
DAMN
did nbot see this comming at all ! so balanced, sweet, dry, dough ( !) damn :o only opther beer i got dough taste in was pumkning by southern tier, but to expect in in lambic? seriously ! genious

Sample from the fermentation vessel at Cantillon Brewery. Included in tour and into a 10 CL sample - Age was 5 months

Still and hazy (of course)
A few boisterous bubbles show at the top of the glass
Nose is insanely grassy. Very little tartness at all. Tons of horse blanket and a wheat floral nose as well
Taste is nicely acidic. Has a lot of wine tannin notes, grape skins and a super horsey almost fecal finish. That may be the most unpleasant thing about this. Everything else is very refreshing

From cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Bright and hazy orange with a big white head. Quite rich, extremely tart, leaves some dryness in the finish. My taste vocabulary struggles a bit with lambics as the tartness seems to dominate - I guess in this one being young its more unripe fruit maybe apples and gooseberries? Anyway, felt hugely complex and tasty, way better than I had expected.

Sampled at the brewery as our first free beer.
Golden wine color, almost no head or carbonation. 
It was a fresh young Lambic, less than 6 months. 
Very sour with not so full body. 
Dry, but not very long, aftertaste.

On tap at the brewery. It pours a clear yellow/straw colour with some big bubbles on top. Great deep complex aroma, very nice and fresh with lots of apple, grapefruit juice, some wood and little dust. Taste is well balanced between the classic geuze sour citrusy notes and the fruity sweetness from the residual sugars. Sourish finish with lots of very fresh apple, grapefruit juice and peel. Amazing. I honestly didnt expect this to be so good.

Sampled at the brewery courtesy of Jean Van Roy. Merci beaucoup. Poured from a Cantillon pitcher. The beer appears clear and nearly still, with a few random bubbles here and there. The aroma is funky, malty, yeasty. tastes of damp earth, ripe fruit. Easy drinking and mild. Full of flavor. A beer to sip and savor, though one could easily drink this by the liter.  An amazing beer to sip whilst chatting away with Jean and staring at barrels upon barrels of Cantillon.

Seems I forgot to rate this one. From the barrel at Cantillon Quintessence.
The young Cantillon lambic, typical bitterness, citric/Brett, lactic acid.
Good lambic.
UPDATED: MAY 1, 2014 2012.10.06 - sample at brewery (brouwkwintessens Cantillon) - nice kickoff of the day

Fresh out of the barrel at the brewery so its definitely "jonge".  You can tell the difference in one thats aged...this is very cloudy, and while its tart the flavors are muddled and it doesnt drink as easily.  Its particularly earthy and dry.  Carbonation is non-existent.

Draught at La Fine Mousse, Paris, 4% ABVHazy golden color, with large compact head. Strong aroma, moderate cellar character, pungent, indeed reminiscent of the Cantillon Faro. Smooth mouthfeel, dry, with delicate malt flavor, delicate lemony acidity, and a very nice pungent character from the Bretts, ending in a rather dry and astringent final.Dynamic, pungent, light; excellent.

(Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels, 22 July 2012) Deep golden colour with frothy, white head. Fruity, acidic nose with unripe green grapes, grapefruit, citrus, cellar and stable. Malty, tart taste with notes of citrus, grapefruit, green grapes, bready malt and a lasting acidity in a dry, tart finish. Medium body, dry. A bit harsh and unrefined, but a very nice lambic.
Had this at the brewery while visiting Brussels .... Very nice.... loved the tour around the brewery.... comes out of a clay pot.....
Tap @ Moeder Lambic. Cloudy amber colour. Aroma is tart, and so is the taste. Sour and bitter sweet.

Tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Hazy pinkish golden appearance with a cream white head. Fairly spicy, lightly funky, basement, mild cheesy, earthy/grassy, lemon, lightly tart aroma. Quite cheesy, parmesan, tangy lemon, light vanilla, woody, spritzy, refreshing flavor. Tart, cheesy, lemon finish. Very refreshing and super easy to drink.

Draught at Moeder Lambic (Fontainas) .  The head gives away its youth but the complexity is already taking shape.  Fresh, light, lemony acidity but still some musty funk.  A great way to start an evening.

Tao at The Craft Beer Co. Pours cloudy orange amber with a nice creamy beige head leaving lace. Aroma is fruity stable cellarand dry and sour. Flavor is very nice; sour vinegar in front, middle brings forward the fruitynesss stable and some bitterness while the sourness mates with the other flavors turning to almost sweet towards the end while mixing with the  saliva gushing from my cheeks. Finishes bitter and sour tart.

The first beer I ordered in Belgium. On draught at Moeder Lambic (Fontainas) 

Pours a sunny yellow color, hazy, with a big very loose rocky head. 

The aroma is lemony, kind of clean (at least for my experiences with Lambic up till the moment that I took these notes). The beer has some nice hay notes and a mild kind of barn-yardiness. 

The flavor is lemony & yogurty, a mild lactic sourness is present and the beer is very earthy. Its simple but still very good and enjoyable.

Quite refreshing.

On draught at Cantillon. Pours a dark golden colour with a lacy white head. Aroma of lemon, horse blanket, wet cardboard and oak. Similar flavours and mildly tart with very low carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Quite dry to finish. Very nice.

16/05/2012 Open Baladin Roma (handpump). Dorata, abbastanza torbida, lievissima schiuma poco persistente. Al naso lieviti selvatici, sentori di stalla, muffa e cantina, intenso agrumato con note citriche. In bocca è acida, decisa, lievemente più morbida della geuze, ma anche più lineare, semplice, manca un po di secchezza nel finale. Corpo medio-basso, leggermente watery, carbonazione quasi assente. Ok.

Cask at Moeder Lambic St Gilles few weeks ago from notes.  I asked the owner, this is the fresh stuff.  Pours golden with a small white head.  Nose is earthy.  Lots of old barn fragrances.  Grass, hay, etc.  A little funk but not much yet.  Flavor is more bitter and sweet, with a tad sour.  Mouthfeel is tight and crisp.  Clean.  Nice to get to try this early.

cask @ moeder Lambic, not sure of the age but they labeled it Jong Lambic.  Citrus notes in the aroma.  Pours golden blonde with little to no head.  Mild funk upfront with sweet citrus notes.  Very drinkable.

Ahh Really good. Thanks SJ.  What was good about this? 

The lemon, lime, earth, peach, melon, grass, sour , sweetness complexities all blended to perfection. Not my favorite style by any mean, but rating it purely on style, it was superb.

I am indebted to blazer06 for providing this one.  Cheers, Zack!  Pours a still hazy yellow.  Nose is vinegar, lactic, white grape, and some yeast.  Flavor is somewhat vinous and tart.  FInish lingers with tart chardonnay character and vinegar-like tartness.  Interesting style that I am interested in gaining experience with.
Decent lambic with a pleasing sourness that is smooth and does not overwhelm.

@ Stone fest , Chez moeder lambic 
Head: white, creamy 
Colour: orange, amber 
Smell: goat cheese, sour, creamy, lambic, white grapes, malts 
Taste: start is smei sour, fruity, sour pinapple, bitter notes, dry sour end , amazing !!
light sour aroma,yellow,clear, nice white foam, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium body, soft carbonation, dry sour finish.

Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas. A real good lambic. Medium orange coloured, and hazy. Has a white head, fully lasting. Aroma of barnyard and something old. Flavor is starting light sweet, finish moderate acidic. Light bitter too. Dry texture, soft carbonation and a bit astringent.

Cask at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Pours a slightly cloudy gold with an average size long-lasting frothy white head. Pleasant Lambic aroma -- yeast, wood, some sourness, fruit, citrus and more. Refreshing and delicious flavour is lightly tart and sour, a bit funky and citrusy along with some wood and a lovely finish thats similar to eating a tasty piece of lemon. Medium bodied. Wow, so easy to drink and pleasant, what an awesome treat -- and on cask!

Very young sample on cask at the Cantillon Brewery and Museum during last weeks Belgium trip. Reviewed from notes.

Served in a Cantillon big-bowl wine glass.

Pours a clear bright orange color with just a few bubbles on top. No head or lacing at all. Pretty color though.

The nose brings forward a light funky cheese along with a touch of lemon peel. The flavor goes more toward the cheese with a bit of a blue-cheese character and light acidity. A slight lingering bitterness is present as well.

Light body with no carbonation. Super thin. Light acidity. Very nice sipper.

This was our first beer after getting off the plane and it did not disappoint. Great way to start the trip.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Moeder Lambic: hazy, light orange with a very persistent foamy white head, smell & taste is a bit fruity upfront with slightly sweet lemons, bit musty, oak, funky with clearly defined hop, followed by a dry medium acidity, creamy & round sourness, pretty much flat, amazing limbic, prefer it young
Non mi piace, troppo ruvido e selvaggio, preferisco di gran lunga altre produzioni, sia di Cantillon che di altri birrifici.

cask at moeder lambic.  pours a dirty yellow with tan highlights just bellow the fizzy centimeter high offwhite head.  aroma of dry bread, lemongrass, grapefruit, and wet socks.  earthy, rustic wet dog, lemon, and stale wheat.   low carbonation, as expected.  complex, tasty, well made.  great beer.

Tap @ the brewery. 
Pours hazy orange with a small, bubbly rim of foam. Aroma is tart, citric, oranges, light apple. Low carbonation, good dry and light oily palate. Flavour is tart, citric, oranges. Rather elegant and very fresh with an okay and finely dry, oaky finish. Good, but Id still rather have a Gueuze.

Cask at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas. It pours slightly hazy golden yellow, with a thick off-white head and low carbonation. The nose is melon, lemon, wood, peach, white sugar and hay. The taste is wood, astringent, light tartness, bread, lemon, lime, cardboard, soap, egg, and hay, with a bitter finish. This is definitely young and really lacks the sourness that makes older Cantillon lambics so drinkable and refreshing.

Rating from older notes, from Kwintessens 2008 at brewery Cantillon.
Hazy orange brown, no to very light carbonation, no real head, just some bubbles from pooring. Rather sweet aroma, some honey, hints of grapes, spices and wood. Waft of tartness. Flavour rather sweet, light acidity, young brett, light grapes and fruit, in some ways reminding of a young wine. Finish rather short, sweetish but leaving a good impression.
(Sample, poored from a mug, @ the brewery)

Tried this directly at the Cantillon brewery. Golden in the glass, small head, not very zippy. Fruity-sourish aroma. Starts intense fruity like ripe fruits, especially apple. Finish a bit moldy, modest sweet background. Really nice!

My first unblended lambic. so forgive this is this is quite a naive rating. It is pretty special, not as assertive as I would have expected. Orange and unclear with a small foamy head. Fruity aroma. Quite dry with citric tartness and funk. The flavour is sharp and moderately dry, with orange tartness and apples. The soft body and no carbonation contrasts with the sharpness of the flavour and is joyous.

Cantillon lambic. Draft at chez moeder. Pours a medium transparent  
bright copper brownish orange with a thin soapy white head... Aroma of  
light acidic vinegar with a subtle funkiness to it. ... Flavors are  
very much akin to the 3 font lambic with no carbonation with less of a  
hop profile and more of a slightly more spicy finish. Once again,  
seems young.
7/4/7/3/14

Draught at Moeder Lambic.  Aged under 12 months and described by the owner as a jonge.  Cear deep yelow color, small fluffy white head that settles slowly to an edge.  Aroma of malt and wheat.  Taste is bright, slight citrus.  Nice character.  Lacks the deep sourness and acidity of the oude version we tasted at the brewery that same morning.

On handpump at Moeder Lambic Fonteinas. 

Translucent yellow and flat, this tastes like lemons, green apples, and white wine. Its thin, lacking in funk, sourness, and lacing, but is supplemented by massive oak floorboards.

Better than the sample at the brewery, but  I do prefer it either older (Bruocsella GC) or blended.
user_location: The Court of the Crimson King, California, USA

text:
Sampled at Cantillon; July 2010
The beer arrives from the barrel with a lightly hazed, amber gold color to it that has almost a single ring of bubbles around the rim of the glass.  The aroma is sweet and cidery smelling up front and has a really interesting pineapple like note to it.  The finish even has some peach-flavored tea like aromas to it.  Aromas like straw as well as a wheat-like grain note in the finish are also found in the nose, but it is the really interesting fruit and tea character that I keep getting drawn too.  This last is so striking and contrasts greatly with the older Lambics from Cantillon.

The beer tastes lightly tart up front and finishes with a tea like flavor as well as some oak woodiness.  This is of course very flat and smooth on the tongue, though there is a touch of texture here (from the oak and lactic character); this is light an quaffable for sure though.  A touch of spicy sourness in the finish doesnt seem to be acetic, in fact I am pretty sure it is not (though this is the usual source of spicy sourness for me).  This also tastes of apricot, peach and more pineapple; it is interesting that the pineapple is so noticeable, it makes me wonder if Brettanomyces Anomolus or Clausenii was particularly strong in this batch; though I suppose the normal Lambic Brett strains can produce similar flavors.

The really incredible fruit character in the nose and mouth makes for an intriguing and tasty Lambic experience.  I really like the unique flavors that this young Lambic has.  I also like that it smells so sweet and fruity, but it is not nearly so sweet in the flavor and that the fruit still manages to carry through to the flavor quite well.  My belly is getting a bit rumbly at the moment as I have definitely been drinking my fair share of Lambic early in the day; what a happy sensation.

In short: Funky sweet and sour apples with lots of wet wood.  Good, not very good.
How: Glass from a pitcher filled from a barrel.  Directly at the brewery
The look: Cloudy golden body topped by a small off-white head
In long: Nose is moderately barnyard and apples notes.  Taste is sour young apples, a lot of wood, some candied apples.  Minimal carbonation.  Not that different from their Oude Lambik I had at Moeder Lambik a few days before.  A little more wet wood but a lot less dry.  A fun tick, but not something I would go back to with so many far superior Cantillon products widely available.  Yet another lambic.  I drank so much lambic during my second stay in Belgium that I was starting to be afraid when someone lit a match around me.
Tap at WOSF10.  Sour apple juice and musty basement aroma.  Hazy amber color with slight head.  Tart, mildly sour apple flavor with an astringent/bitter finish - a tad harsh.
At the brewery.Cloudy  golden colour with off-white head.Aroma of barnyard and wood,sourish and dry with hint of greaps and acid,good well balanced mouthfeels and dry finish.

On draft at Moeder Lambic. Pale amber with virtially zero carbonation. Oddly malty aroma, with notes of sour apple skin and wood. Lots of wet wood, lemon, and mild funk. Gentle, a bit watery, with a touch of residual sugar and a tart finish. Very interesting from a work-in-progress perspective, but not my lambic of choice.

Couple samples at the brewery.  Pours a golden yellow with no head.  Fairly still.  Aroma of barnyard funk, lemons and other bitter elements.  Flavor is fairly bitter, with the sour, tart and funk in there also.  Basically, just adds another flavor to the mix, bitter lemon peel.  Very good, as you would expect, but I prefer the older and blended versions.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2010 Party keg at De Nacht van de Grote Dorst 2010. Clear golden - no head. Cheese, light sourness, lots of cheese, nice sourness, wooden, oakey, medium sweetness, leather, tartness, grape fruity.

Draught. 2008. Orange coloured. Unclear. Earth, tense sourness, light barnyard and leather. Flavour full of sourness and grape. Loads of earthy notes. Medium to full bodied. Ends on a very sour and citric note. NIce.
Cloudy amber with no head. Sourish aroma with apples wood and barnyard. Flavour had plenty of barnyard, sour apples and wood plus leather. Finished sour.

From tap at the brewery. Pours slight hazy/cloudy and golden orange with a huge, bubbly and white head - slowly diminishing. Aroma is tart barnyard, light winegrape fruity. Bitter and light acidic flavoured, vague sweetness beneath. Subdued malt note and a mild dry brett to tart pedicoccus acdity into the finish. Smooth fruity and tart far finish. Nice one.

Draft @ Cantillon. Pours a slightly hazy orange color with no head. Has a fruity slightly sweet citrus and grapefruit aroma with some hints of barnyard. Fruity malty grapefruit flavor with some woody hints. Has a fruity malty finish with hints of grapefruit and wood in the aftertaste.

(Draught, at the brewery)  Pours a hazy golden body with scattered big bubbles a top.  Aroma of mustiness, cobweb, grapefruit, and barnyard.  Flavor of wood, earth, white wine, and grapefruit peel with a mildly bitter finish.

Draught at the Football Pub, Rome.  Labeled as the Jonge lambik.  Classic Cantillon character, sour, lots of yeast.  Some acid.  No carbonation really.  What stands out about this beer is how mild it is, surely the least sour Cantillon I have ever had.  It is still wonderful, as every Cantillon is, but this is very approachable; it reminds me of the Broucilla.
Sample at brewery: Cloudy gold with small bubbles on top. Flat, not as sour as the regular gueze, cellar, mouldy, earthy, woody & fruity. Nice experience.

Aroma:  honey, flowers, some earthiness and mustiness

Appearance:  slightly murky brown, small white head, little lacing

Flavor:  lightness, light tartness/sourness, some grass, hay and barnyard, lite brown sugar

Palate:  lite tartness with some fruit, slightly lactic aftertaste

Cloudy honey colored body with a small white head. Very faint nose of moderately sweet bandaid and tart cherry pits and apple skins. Vinuous and oily on the tongue, tannic honey and cherry pits are the dominant flavors. Slightly sweet and moderately complex. Very nice.

GBBF, 2007. Not sure if this was cask or bottle. Someone just handed me a glass of it. (Thanks--whoever it was!) Copper, no head. Cinnamon, lemon, wool, mineral--very funky but such a fresh aroma! Vast tart waves, coating the mouth, puckering. But the sourness has a focus and intentionality to it that is very engaging. Leather, cinnamon, wool. Incredably refreshing.
Sampled at the brewery. Hazy golden and orange in colour. Nice tartness with notes of honey, citrus, wood, earth, barnyard and still very refreshing.
Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 07.  Slightly cloudy gold.  Nose is meaty honey, some bright fruit, very woody.  Flavor is bitter honey, lemon, very musty & clay like.  Bitter finish.

Draught. Hazy orange colour, minor head. Aroma is smooth wood. Flavour is wood,some sourness and slight notes of sweet grass. A very "smooth" lambic by Cantillon. Was one of my favourite lambics tested at the weekend of spontaneous fermentation.

A Mes rate: 
Draught from December 2006 apparently. One of the best young lambics I have had. Smells very young and has an unbrewed malt hint to it. Very wheaty and has a smell that is incredibly similar to the brewery itself. Quiet amazingly so. Extremely strong malt for a lambic. Very unusual for a lambic so young. Yum!

Draught at weekend of spontanious fermentation.
Hazy amber coloured with no head.
Fruity aroma of wheat and wood with light acidic anotes.
Light acidic flavour of wood and fruits.
Tart finish.

Draught @ 16th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2007, Optal. Hazy orange color with virtually none head. Aroma is fruity, spices, wood. Flavor is moderate sweet and acidic (fruit sweet) with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat to soft.
On tap on beerfestival in Buggenhout 2007. Rather smoot lambic.Stil vety intresting beer

Cask at GBBF 2005: aroma is earthy, burnyard hay and grapefruit. acidic mouthfill but not too much. The flavor is  very sour almost and bone dry, lemony with grapefruit peels bitterness, a bit woody as well, refreshing and rich at the same time. A very good straightforward none complex lambic but not for beginners, it might be too dry and too sour for them.

Draught at ´t Spinnekopke, Brussels. No indication of age, but appeared with a thin, fine-bubbled and stable head above the cloudy orangey golden beer. Sour lambik aroma, yoghurt, mellow citrus. Sharp acidic flavours, hint of yoghurt, wood towards the finish, very dry. An amazing complexity of citrus. Lightish body, dry mouthfeel. One of the world´s great beers.

Cloudy golden beer.
Fruity aroma with notes of acid, honey and citrus.
Somewhat acidic flavour with notes of rubber. No carbonation. Long bitterness but without the hop bite.

Draught. Hazy orange with a small bubbly white head. The aroma is huge - dusty and earthy with lots of acetic wood and apricot fruitiness. Very sharp and acidic - woody again, and puckeringly tart. Refreshing citrus with wheaty undertones. Excellent stuff.

Sampled at the Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation on May 28, 2006.

Unclear golden body; Great deep complex not overpowered  nose, very nice and fresh with lots of apple, grapefruit juice, some wood and also some hop; Very sour body (not to the extreme), but I still think it overpowers the complexity a bit; Into fine sour finish with lots of very fresh apple, grapefruit juice and peel. Super!

At Cantillon Brewery, Brussels. No carbonation, great mouthfeel. Soft, very dry, with a juicy acidity. Tastes very fresh for a lambic. Citric acidity, covers every corner of the mouth. I could drink this all afternoon, one of the most drinkable lambics ive had.

Tap at Monks Cafe.  Sour, but quite manageable even for a beginning palate.  Straight lambic, but detected fruity notes nonetheless, of pear and sour apple.  light bodied and colored.  Pleasant, and an excellent antidote to a couple of overly sweet beers.

Couleur dorée, apparence brouillée, quelques grosses bulles éphémères.  Arômes de bois, dagrumes, de zeste et de vin blanc.  Acidité tranchante en bouche, lactique, citronnée, une faible part de sucre résiduel toujours présent. Corps plutôt atténué, faible carbonatation.  Ça cest du lambic !  En fût, Brasserie Cantillon, Bruxelles, Décembre 2005.

Apricot and grape are prominent in the tart and tangy, acidic aroma with some sweaty barnyard and woody character.  Hazy golden orange-yellow with low white fully diminishing head.  Apricot, grapes, rubber, honey, barnyard and mint flavours blend together wonderfully in the musty flavour that leads through to a light, tart, dry finish.  Medium-light body with no carbonation.  Very easy to drink.  Cask at GBBF 2005.

Cask @ GBBF
This is my first Cantillon beer.  Slightly hazy gold colour with oaky aromas.  Very sour lemon and woody flavours.  For someone who has never had a real straight lambic before, it is quite a novelty.  Wouldnt want to drink a lot of it, but I can certainly see why people rate this highly

I have had this several times at the brewery straight from the wooden casks and kegged at GBBF. Naturally this varies a great deal from cask to cask, but I always enjoy quenching my thirst with it. Very complex and very refreshing with lots of grapefruit notes. I love unblended lambic.
Draught, Int Spinnekopke. Cloudy golden with minimal head. Low carbonation, fruity (grapefruits), mellow sourness. A gentle cantillon. Served cold and was very pleasent on a hot summer day.

2003 vintage, draught sampling.  Tart, citric aroma, particularly lemony, lightly farmy with notes of straw and wood, but fruity and showing hints of wheat and flowery perfume.  Opaque light golden color, lacking a head and lacing altogether, interestingly.  Flavor begins with a burst of tart, juicy citrus, more lemon and grapefruit, then sees an influx of woody earthiness, before finishing on an acidic, wheat malt note.  Apparently the "base" for the Kriek, Gueuze, etc.  Palate is smooth, practically carbonation-free.  Body is light-medium.  Interesting and unique, to say the least.

2003. From the barrel. Fruity sour nose, lactic, but not harsh. Hazy amber-gold with no head. Light-medium body with light carbonation. Tangy taste, smooth sourness with hint of peach. Finish is sour, woody. After is dry, light bitter.

Im guessing this beer belongs here as there doesnt seem to be any other draught unblended Cantillon lambic on the site and I cant believe Im the first to have tried it. Tim Webb has a beer listed as "Lambic Cantillon" but no mention of the "Jonge" version. I have sometimes found that the straight lambics are much softer and less challenging that their gueuze counterparts, to such an extent that I find them less enjoyable. Dammit, I want my lambics to be extreme. Whilst the Cantillon lambic is marginally softer than the gueuze, its still pretty uncompromising with plenty of manure, wood, lemon and sour sharpness. Classic Cantillon. Draught, GBBF 2004, day 1.
Hazy orange body, no head.  Citric aroma with some soured milk.  Heavily acidic, lightly bitter initial flavour.  Moderately acidic finish (averagily long).
An orange beer with no head. The aroma is very light but sour. The flavor is very sour of lemon, wood, and grapefruit. The end is very dry and woody.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2014 Tasted august 2003, at the brewery. Glass poured by JP van Roy himself, straight from cask. Slightly cloudy, no head at all. Aroma has grapes, oak and citrus, the dustiness of the brewery. Immensely complex though young. Apple, honey, oak, lemon, sour cherries, marmelade, glue. Absolutely not too sour, but with a sharp edge. Great beer with enormous depth in aroma and flavor.


Taster @ Borefts 2014. Golden blonde, cloudy. Sulphury citric aroma. Bretty. Complex flavor, sweetish, still sulphury. pineapple. lemon and oak.

Beer has the colour of dewy apricots; slim ring of big bubbles. Woody nose, sulphury, grapefruit or grapefruit peel. Tart taste, hint of malt all the same, lemony, sweet grapefruit, chardonnay and sultanas. Light bodied, but with hints of still fermentable sugars. Superb, delightfull lambik, ideal with its fruity tones for blending great things with.
